scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Proceed, Solinus, to procure my fall

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And by the doom of death end woes and all.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Merchant of Syracuse, plead no more;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: I am not partial to infringe our laws:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: The enmity and discord which of late

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Sprung from the rancorous outrage of your duke

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: To merchants, our well-dealing countrymen,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Who wanting guilders to redeem their lives

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Have seal'd his rigorous statutes with their bloods,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Excludes all pity from our threatening looks.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: For, since the mortal and intestine jars

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: 'Twixt thy seditious countrymen and us,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: It hath in solemn synods been decreed

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Both by the Syracusians and ourselves,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: To admit no traffic to our adverse towns Nay, more,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: If any born at Ephesus be seen

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: At any Syracusian marts and fairs;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Again: if any Syracusian born

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Come to the bay of Ephesus, he dies,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: His goods confiscate to the duke's dispose,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Unless a thousand marks be levied,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: To quit the penalty and to ransom him.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Thy substance, valued at the highest rate,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Cannot amount unto a hundred marks;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Therefore by law thou art condemned to die.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Yet this my comfort: when your words are done,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: My woes end likewise with the evening sun.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Well, Syracusian, say in brief the cause

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Why thou departed'st from thy native home

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: And for what cause thou camest to Ephesus.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: A heavier task could not have been imposed

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Than I to speak my griefs unspeakable:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Yet, that the world may witness that my end

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Was wrought by nature, not by vile offence,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: I'll utter what my sorrows give me leave.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: In Syracusa was I born, and wed

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Unto a woman, happy but for me,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And by me, had not our hap been bad.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: With her I lived in joy; our wealth increased

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: By prosperous voyages I often made

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: To Epidamnum; till my factor's death

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And the great care of goods at random left

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Drew me from kind embracements of my spouse:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: From whom my absence was not six months old

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Before herself, almost at fainting under

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: The pleasing punishment that women bear,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Had made provision for her following me

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And soon and safe arrived where I was.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: There had she not been long, but she became

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: A joyful mother of two goodly sons;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And, which was strange, the one so like the other,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: As could not be distinguish'd but by names.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: That very hour, and in the self-same inn,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: A meaner woman was delivered

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Of such a burden, male twins, both alike:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Those,--for their parents were exceeding poor,--

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: I bought and brought up to attend my sons.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: My wife, not meanly proud of two such boys,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Made daily motions for our home return:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Unwilling I agreed. Alas! too soon,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: We came aboard.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: A league from Epidamnum had we sail'd,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Before the always wind-obeying deep

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Gave any tragic instance of our harm:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: But longer did we not retain much hope;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: For what obscured light the heavens did grant

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Did but convey unto our fearful minds

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: A doubtful warrant of immediate death;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Which though myself would gladly have embraced,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Yet the incessant weepings of my wife,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Weeping before for what she saw must come,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And piteous plainings of the pretty babes,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: That mourn'd for fashion, ignorant what to fear,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Forced me to seek delays for them and me.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And this it was, for other means was none:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: The sailors sought for safety by our boat,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And left the ship, then sinking-ripe, to us:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: My wife, more careful for the latter-born,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Had fasten'd him unto a small spare mast,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Such as seafaring men provide for storms;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: To him one of the other twins was bound,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Whilst I had been like heedful of the other:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: The children thus disposed, my wife and I,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Fixing our eyes on whom our care was fix'd,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Fasten'd ourselves at either end the mast;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And floating straight, obedient to the stream,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Was carried towards Corinth, as we thought.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: At length the sun, gazing upon the earth,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Dispersed those vapours that offended us;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And by the benefit of his wished light,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: The seas wax'd calm, and we discovered

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Two ships from far making amain to us,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Of Corinth that, of Epidaurus this:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: But ere they came,--O, let me say no more!

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Gather the sequel by that went before.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Nay, forward, old man; do not break off so;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: For we may pity, though not pardon thee.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: O, had the gods done so, I had not now

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Worthily term'd them merciless to us!

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: For, ere the ships could meet by twice five leagues,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: We were encounterd by a mighty rock;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Which being violently borne upon,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Our helpful ship was splitted in the midst;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: So that, in this unjust divorce of us,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Fortune had left to both of us alike

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: What to delight in, what to sorrow for.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Her part, poor soul! seeming as burdened

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: With lesser weight but not with lesser woe,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Was carried with more speed before the wind;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And in our sight they three were taken up

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: By fishermen of Corinth, as we thought.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: At length, another ship had seized on us;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And, knowing whom it was their hap to save,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Gave healthful welcome to their shipwreck'd guests;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And would have reft the fishers of their prey,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Had not their bark been very slow of sail;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And therefore homeward did they bend their course.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Thus have you heard me sever'd from my bliss;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: That by misfortunes was my life prolong'd,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: To tell sad stories of my own mishaps.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: And for the sake of them thou sorrowest for,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Do me the favour to dilate at full

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: What hath befall'n of them and thee till now.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: My youngest boy, and yet my eldest care,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: At eighteen years became inquisitive

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: After his brother: and importuned me

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: That his attendant--so his case was like,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Reft of his brother, but retain'd his name--

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Might bear him company in the quest of him:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Whom whilst I labour'd of a love to see,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: I hazarded the loss of whom I loved.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Five summers have I spent in furthest Greece,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Roaming clean through the bounds of Asia,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And, coasting homeward, came to Ephesus;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Hopeless to find, yet loath to leave unsought

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Or that or any place that harbours men.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: But here must end the story of my life;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: And happy were I in my timely death,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Could all my travels warrant me they live.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Hapless AEgeon, whom the fates have mark'd

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: To bear the extremity of dire mishap!

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Now, trust me, were it not against our laws,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Against my crown, my oath, my dignity,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Which princes, would they, may not disannul,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: My soul would sue as advocate for thee.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: But, though thou art adjudged to the death

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: And passed sentence may not be recall'd

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: But to our honour's great disparagement,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Yet I will favour thee in what I can.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Therefore, merchant, I'll limit thee this day

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: To seek thy life by beneficial help:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Try all the friends thou hast in Ephesus;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Beg thou, or borrow, to make up the sum,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: And live; if no, then thou art doom'd to die.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS
line: Gaoler, take him to thy custody.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: Gaoler
line: I will, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: Hopeless and helpless doth AEgeon wend,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
speaker: AEGEON
line: But to procrastinate his lifeless end.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: Therefore give out you are of Epidamnum,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: Lest that your goods too soon be confiscate.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: This very day a Syracusian merchant

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: Is apprehended for arrival here;

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: And not being able to buy out his life

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: According to the statute of the town,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: Dies ere the weary sun set in the west.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: There is your money that I had to keep.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Go bear it to the Centaur, where we host,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And stay there, Dromio, till I come to thee.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Within this hour it will be dinner-time:

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Till that, I'll view the manners of the town,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Peruse the traders, gaze upon the buildings,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And then return and sleep within mine inn,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: For with long travel I am stiff and weary.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Get thee away.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Many a man would take you at your word,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: And go indeed, having so good a mean.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: A trusty villain, sir, that very oft,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: When I am dull with care and melancholy,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Lightens my humour with his merry jests.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What, will you walk with me about the town,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And then go to my inn and dine with me?

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: I am invited, sir, to certain merchants,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: Of whom I hope to make much benefit;

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: I crave your pardon. Soon at five o'clock,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: Please you, I'll meet with you upon the mart

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: And afterward consort you till bed-time:

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: My present business calls me from you now.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Farewell till then: I will go lose myself

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And wander up and down to view the city.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: First Merchant
line: Sir, I commend you to your own content.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: He that commends me to mine own content

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Commends me to the thing I cannot get.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I to the world am like a drop of water

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: That in the ocean seeks another drop,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Who, falling there to find his fellow forth,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Unseen, inquisitive, confounds himself:

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: So I, to find a mother and a brother,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: In quest of them, unhappy, lose myself.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Here comes the almanac of my true date.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What now? how chance thou art return'd so soon?

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Return'd so soon! rather approach'd too late:

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: The capon burns, the pig falls from the spit,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: The clock hath strucken twelve upon the bell;

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: My mistress made it one upon my cheek:

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: She is so hot because the meat is cold;

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: The meat is cold because you come not home;

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: You come not home because you have no stomach;

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: You have no stomach having broke your fast;

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: But we that know what 'tis to fast and pray

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Are penitent for your default to-day.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Stop in your wind, sir: tell me this, I pray:

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Where have you left the money that I gave you?

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: O,--sixpence, that I had o' Wednesday last

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: To pay the saddler for my mistress' crupper?

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: The saddler had it, sir; I kept it not.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I am not in a sportive humour now:

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Tell me, and dally not, where is the money?

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: We being strangers here, how darest thou trust

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: So great a charge from thine own custody?

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: I pray you, air, as you sit at dinner:

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: I from my mistress come to you in post;

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: If I return, I shall be post indeed,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: For she will score your fault upon my pate.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Methinks your maw, like mine, should be your clock,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: And strike you home without a messenger.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Come, Dromio, come, these jests are out of season;

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Reserve them till a merrier hour than this.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Where is the gold I gave in charge to thee?

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: To me, sir? why, you gave no gold to me.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Come on, sir knave, have done your foolishness,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And tell me how thou hast disposed thy charge.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: My charge was but to fetch you from the mart

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Home to your house, the Phoenix, sir, to dinner:

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: My mistress and her sister stays for you.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: In what safe place you have bestow'd my money,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Or I shall break that merry sconce of yours

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: That stands on tricks when I am undisposed:

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Where is the thousand marks thou hadst of me?

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: I have some marks of yours upon my pate,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Some of my mistress' marks upon my shoulders,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: But not a thousand marks between you both.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: If I should pay your worship those again,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Perchance you will not bear them patiently.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Thy mistress' marks? what mistress, slave, hast thou?

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Your worship's wife, my mistress at the Phoenix;

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: She that doth fast till you come home to dinner,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: And prays that you will hie you home to dinner.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What, wilt thou flout me thus unto my face,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Being forbid? There, take you that, sir knave.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: What mean you, sir? for God's sake, hold your hands!

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Nay, and you will not, sir, I'll take my heels.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Upon my life, by some device or other

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: The villain is o'er-raught of all my money.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: They say this town is full of cozenage,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: As, nimble jugglers that deceive the eye,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Dark-working sorcerers that change the mind,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Soul-killing witches that deform the body,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Disguised cheaters, prating mountebanks,

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And many such-like liberties of sin:

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: If it prove so, I will be gone the sooner.

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I'll to the Centaur, to go seek this slave:

scene: SCENE II.  The Mart.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I greatly fear my money is not safe.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Neither my husband nor the slave return'd,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: That in such haste I sent to seek his master!

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Sure, Luciana, it is two o'clock.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Perhaps some merchant hath invited him,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: And from the mart he's somewhere gone to dinner.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Good sister, let us dine and never fret:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: A man is master of his liberty:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Time is their master, and, when they see time,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: They'll go or come: if so, be patient, sister.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Why should their liberty than ours be more?

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Because their business still lies out o' door.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Look, when I serve him so, he takes it ill.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: O, know he is the bridle of your will.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: There's none but asses will be bridled so.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Why, headstrong liberty is lash'd with woe.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: There's nothing situate under heaven's eye

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: But hath his bound, in earth, in sea, in sky:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: The beasts, the fishes, and the winged fowls,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Are their males' subjects and at their controls:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Men, more divine, the masters of all these,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Lords of the wide world and wild watery seas,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Indued with intellectual sense and souls,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Of more preeminence than fish and fowls,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Are masters to their females, and their lords:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Then let your will attend on their accords.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: This servitude makes you to keep unwed.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Not this, but troubles of the marriage-bed.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: But, were you wedded, you would bear some sway.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Ere I learn love, I'll practise to obey.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: How if your husband start some other where?

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Till he come home again, I would forbear.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Patience unmoved! no marvel though she pause;

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: They can be meek that have no other cause.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: A wretched soul, bruised with adversity,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: We bid be quiet when we hear it cry;

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: But were we burdened with like weight of pain,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: As much or more would we ourselves complain:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: So thou, that hast no unkind mate to grieve thee,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: With urging helpless patience wouldst relieve me,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: But, if thou live to see like right bereft,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: This fool-begg'd patience in thee will be left.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Well, I will marry one day, but to try.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Here comes your man; now is your husband nigh.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Say, is your tardy master now at hand?

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Nay, he's at two hands with me, and that my two ears

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: can witness.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Say, didst thou speak with him? know'st thou his mind?

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Ay, ay, he told his mind upon mine ear:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Beshrew his hand, I scarce could understand it.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Spake he so doubtfully, thou couldst not feel his meaning?

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Nay, he struck so plainly, I could too well feel his

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: blows; and withal so doubtfully that I could scarce

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: understand them.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: But say, I prithee, is he coming home? It seems he

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: hath great care to please his wife.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Why, mistress, sure my master is horn-mad.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Horn-mad, thou villain!

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: I mean not cuckold-mad;

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: But, sure, he is stark mad.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: When I desired him to come home to dinner,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: He ask'd me for a thousand marks in gold:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: ''Tis dinner-time,' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he;

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: 'Your meat doth burn,' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: 'Will you come home?' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: 'Where is the thousand marks I gave thee, villain?'

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: 'The pig,' quoth I, 'is burn'd;' 'My gold!' quoth he:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: 'My mistress, sir' quoth I; 'Hang up thy mistress!

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: I know not thy mistress; out on thy mistress!'

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Quoth who?

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Quoth my master:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: 'I know,' quoth he, 'no house, no wife, no mistress.'

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: So that my errand, due unto my tongue,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: I thank him, I bare home upon my shoulders;

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: For, in conclusion, he did beat me there.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Go back again, thou slave, and fetch him home.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Go back again, and be new beaten home?

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: For God's sake, send some other messenger.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Back, slave, or I will break thy pate across.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: And he will bless that cross with other beating:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Between you I shall have a holy head.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Hence, prating peasant! fetch thy master home.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Am I so round with you as you with me,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: That like a football you do spurn me thus?

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: You spurn me hence, and he will spurn me hither:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: If I last in this service, you must case me in leather.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Fie, how impatience loureth in your face!

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: His company must do his minions grace,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Whilst I at home starve for a merry look.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Hath homely age the alluring beauty took

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: From my poor cheek? then he hath wasted it:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Are my discourses dull? barren my wit?

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: If voluble and sharp discourse be marr'd,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Unkindness blunts it more than marble hard:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Do their gay vestments his affections bait?

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: That's not my fault: he's master of my state:

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: What ruins are in me that can be found,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: By him not ruin'd? then is he the ground

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Of my defeatures. My decayed fair

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: A sunny look of his would soon repair

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: But, too unruly deer, he breaks the pale

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And feeds from home; poor I am but his stale.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Self-harming jealousy! fie, beat it hence!

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Unfeeling fools can with such wrongs dispense.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I know his eye doth homage otherwhere,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Or else what lets it but he would be here?

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Sister, you know he promised me a chain;

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Would that alone, alone he would detain,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: So he would keep fair quarter with his bed!

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I see the jewel best enamelled

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Will lose his beauty; yet the gold bides still,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: That others touch, and often touching will

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Wear gold: and no man that hath a name,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: By falsehood and corruption doth it shame.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Since that my beauty cannot please his eye,

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I'll weep what's left away, and weeping die.

scene: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: How many fond fools serve mad jealousy!

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: The gold I gave to Dromio is laid up

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Safe at the Centaur; and the heedful slave

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Is wander'd forth, in care to seek me out

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: By computation and mine host's report.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I could not speak with Dromio since at first

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I sent him from the mart. See, here he comes.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: How now sir! is your merry humour alter'd?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: As you love strokes, so jest with me again.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: You know no Centaur? you received no gold?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Your mistress sent to have me home to dinner?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: My house was at the Phoenix? Wast thou mad,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: That thus so madly thou didst answer me?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: What answer, sir? when spake I such a word?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Even now, even here, not half an hour since.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: I did not see you since you sent me hence,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Home to the Centaur, with the gold you gave me.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Villain, thou didst deny the gold's receipt,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And told'st me of a mistress and a dinner;

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: For which, I hope, thou felt'st I was displeased.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: I am glad to see you in this merry vein:

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: What means this jest? I pray you, master, tell me.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Yea, dost thou jeer and flout me in the teeth?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Think'st thou I jest? Hold, take thou that, and that.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Hold, sir, for God's sake! now your jest is earnest:

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Upon what bargain do you give it me?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Because that I familiarly sometimes

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Do use you for my fool and chat with you,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Your sauciness will jest upon my love

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And make a common of my serious hours.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: When the sun shines let foolish gnats make sport,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: But creep in crannies when he hides his beams.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: If you will jest with me, know my aspect,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And fashion your demeanor to my looks,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Or I will beat this method in your sconce.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Sconce call you it? so you would leave battering, I

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: had rather have it a head: an you use these blows

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: long, I must get a sconce for my head and ensconce

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: it too; or else I shall seek my wit in my shoulders.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: But, I pray, sir why am I beaten?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Dost thou not know?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Nothing, sir, but that I am beaten.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Shall I tell you why?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Ay, sir, and wherefore; for they say every why hath

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: a wherefore.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Why, first,--for flouting me; and then, wherefore--

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: For urging it the second time to me.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Was there ever any man thus beaten out of season,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: When in the why and the wherefore is neither rhyme

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: nor reason?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Well, sir, I thank you.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Thank me, sir, for what?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Marry, sir, for this something that you gave me for nothing.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I'll make you amends next, to give you nothing for

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: something. But say, sir, is it dinner-time?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: No, sir; I think the meat wants that I have.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: In good time, sir; what's that?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Basting.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Well, sir, then 'twill be dry.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: If it be, sir, I pray you, eat none of it.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Your reason?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Lest it make you choleric and purchase me another

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: dry basting.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Well, sir, learn to jest in good time: there's a

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: time for all things.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: I durst have denied that, before you were so choleric.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: By what rule, sir?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Marry, sir, by a rule as plain as the plain bald

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: pate of father Time himself.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Let's hear it.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: There's no time for a man to recover his hair that

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: grows bald by nature.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: May he not do it by fine and recovery?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Yes, to pay a fine for a periwig and recover the

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: lost hair of another man.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Why is Time such a niggard of hair, being, as it is,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: so plentiful an excrement?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Because it is a blessing that he bestows on beasts;

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: and what he hath scanted men in hair he hath given them in wit.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Why, but there's many a man hath more hair than wit.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Not a man of those but he hath the wit to lose his hair.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Why, thou didst conclude hairy men plain dealers without wit.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: The plainer dealer, the sooner lost: yet he loseth

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: it in a kind of jollity.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: For what reason?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: For two; and sound ones too.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Nay, not sound, I pray you.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Sure ones, then.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Nay, not sure, in a thing falsing.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Certain ones then.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Name them.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: The one, to save the money that he spends in

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: trimming; the other, that at dinner they should not

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: drop in his porridge.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: You would all this time have proved there is no

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: time for all things.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Marry, and did, sir; namely, no time to recover hair

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: lost by nature.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: But your reason was not substantial, why there is no

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: time to recover.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Thus I mend it: Time himself is bald and therefore

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: to the world's end will have bald followers.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I knew 'twould be a bald conclusion:

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: But, soft! who wafts us yonder?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Ay, ay, Antipholus, look strange and frown:

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Some other mistress hath thy sweet aspects;

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I am not Adriana nor thy wife.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: The time was once when thou unurged wouldst vow

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: That never words were music to thine ear,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: That never object pleasing in thine eye,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: That never touch well welcome to thy hand,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: That never meat sweet-savor'd in thy taste,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Unless I spake, or look'd, or touch'd, or carved to thee.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: How comes it now, my husband, O, how comes it,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: That thou art thus estranged from thyself?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Thyself I call it, being strange to me,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: That, undividable, incorporate,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Am better than thy dear self's better part.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Ah, do not tear away thyself from me!

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: For know, my love, as easy mayest thou fall

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: A drop of water in the breaking gulf,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And take unmingled that same drop again,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Without addition or diminishing,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: As take from me thyself and not me too.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: How dearly would it touch me to the quick,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Shouldst thou but hear I were licentious

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And that this body, consecrate to thee,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: By ruffian lust should be contaminate!

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Wouldst thou not spit at me and spurn at me

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And hurl the name of husband in my face

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And tear the stain'd skin off my harlot-brow

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And from my false hand cut the wedding-ring

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And break it with a deep-divorcing vow?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I know thou canst; and therefore see thou do it.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I am possess'd with an adulterate blot;

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: My blood is mingled with the crime of lust:

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: For if we too be one and thou play false,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I do digest the poison of thy flesh,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Being strumpeted by thy contagion.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Keep then far league and truce with thy true bed;

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I live unstain'd, thou undishonoured.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Plead you to me, fair dame? I know you not:

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: In Ephesus I am but two hours old,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: As strange unto your town as to your talk;

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Who, every word by all my wit being scann'd,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Want wit in all one word to understand.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Fie, brother! how the world is changed with you!

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: When were you wont to use my sister thus?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: She sent for you by Dromio home to dinner.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: By Dromio?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: By me?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: By thee; and this thou didst return from him,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: That he did buffet thee, and, in his blows,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Denied my house for his, me for his wife.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Did you converse, sir, with this gentlewoman?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What is the course and drift of your compact?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: I, sir? I never saw her till this time.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Villain, thou liest; for even her very words

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Didst thou deliver to me on the mart.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: I never spake with her in all my life.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: How can she thus then call us by our names,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Unless it be by inspiration.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: How ill agrees it with your gravity

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: To counterfeit thus grossly with your slave,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Abetting him to thwart me in my mood!

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Be it my wrong you are from me exempt,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: But wrong not that wrong with a more contempt.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Come, I will fasten on this sleeve of thine:

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Thou art an elm, my husband, I a vine,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Whose weakness, married to thy stronger state,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Makes me with thy strength to communicate:

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: If aught possess thee from me, it is dross,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Usurping ivy, brier, or idle moss;

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Who, all for want of pruning, with intrusion

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Infect thy sap and live on thy confusion.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: To me she speaks; she moves me for her theme:

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What, was I married to her in my dream?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Or sleep I now and think I hear all this?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What error drives our eyes and ears amiss?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Until I know this sure uncertainty,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I'll entertain the offer'd fallacy.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Dromio, go bid the servants spread for dinner.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: O, for my beads! I cross me for a sinner.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: This is the fairy land: O spite of spites!

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: We talk with goblins, owls and sprites:

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: If we obey them not, this will ensue,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: They'll suck our breath, or pinch us black and blue.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Why pratest thou to thyself and answer'st not?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Dromio, thou drone, thou snail, thou slug, thou sot!

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: I am transformed, master, am I not?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I think thou art in mind, and so am I.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Nay, master, both in mind and in my shape.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Thou hast thine own form.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: No, I am an ape.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: If thou art changed to aught, 'tis to an ass.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: 'Tis true; she rides me and I long for grass.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: 'Tis so, I am an ass; else it could never be

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: But I should know her as well as she knows me.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Come, come, no longer will I be a fool,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: To put the finger in the eye and weep,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Whilst man and master laugh my woes to scorn.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Come, sir, to dinner. Dromio, keep the gate.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Husband, I'll dine above with you to-day

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And shrive you of a thousand idle pranks.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Sirrah, if any ask you for your master,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Say he dines forth, and let no creature enter.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Come, sister. Dromio, play the porter well.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Am I in earth, in heaven, or in hell?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Sleeping or waking? mad or well-advised?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Known unto these, and to myself disguised!

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I'll say as they say and persever so,

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And in this mist at all adventures go.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Master, shall I be porter at the gate?

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Ay; and let none enter, lest I break your pate.

scene: SCENE II.  A public place.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Come, come, Antipholus, we dine too late.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: OF EPHESUS
line: Good Signior Angelo, you must excuse us all;

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: OF EPHESUS
line: My wife is shrewish when I keep not hours:

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: OF EPHESUS
line: Say that I linger'd with you at your shop

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: OF EPHESUS
line: To see the making of her carcanet,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: OF EPHESUS
line: And that to-morrow you will bring it home.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: OF EPHESUS
line: But here's a villain that would face me down

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: OF EPHESUS
line: He met me on the mart, and that I beat him,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: OF EPHESUS
line: And charged him with a thousand marks in gold,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: OF EPHESUS
line: And that I did deny my wife and house.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: OF EPHESUS
line: Thou drunkard, thou, what didst thou mean by this?

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Say what you will, sir, but I know what I know;

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: That you beat me at the mart, I have your hand to show:

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: If the skin were parchment, and the blows you gave were ink,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Your own handwriting would tell you what I think.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I think thou art an ass.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Marry, so it doth appear

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: By the wrongs I suffer and the blows I bear.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: I should kick, being kick'd; and, being at that pass,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: You would keep from my heels and beware of an ass.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: You're sad, Signior Balthazar: pray God our cheer

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: May answer my good will and your good welcome here.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: I hold your dainties cheap, sir, and your

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: welcome dear.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: O, Signior Balthazar, either at flesh or fish,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: A table full of welcome make scarce one dainty dish.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: Good meat, sir, is common; that every churl affords.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And welcome more common; for that's nothing but words.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: Small cheer and great welcome makes a merry feast.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Ay, to a niggardly host, and more sparing guest:

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: But though my cates be mean, take them in good part;

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Better cheer may you have, but not with better heart.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: But, soft! my door is lock'd. Go bid them let us in.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Maud, Bridget, Marian, Cicel, Gillian, Ginn!

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Within  Mome, malt-horse, capon, coxcomb,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: idiot, patch!

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Either get thee from the door, or sit down at the hatch.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Dost thou conjure for wenches, that thou call'st

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: for such store,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: When one is one too many? Go, get thee from the door.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: What patch is made our porter? My master stays in

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: the street.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Within  Let him walk from whence he came, lest he

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: catch cold on's feet.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Who talks within there? ho, open the door!

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Within  Right, sir; I'll tell you when, an you tell

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: me wherefore.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Wherefore? for my dinner: I have not dined to-day.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Within  Nor to-day here you must not; come again

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: when you may.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: What art thou that keepest me out from the house I owe?

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Within  The porter for this time, sir, and my name

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: is Dromio.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: O villain! thou hast stolen both mine office and my name.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: The one ne'er got me credit, the other mickle blame.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: If thou hadst been Dromio to-day in my place,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Thou wouldst have changed thy face for a name or thy

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: name for an ass.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCE
line: Within  What a coil is there, Dromio? who are those

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCE
line: at the gate?

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Let my master in, Luce.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCE
line: Within  Faith, no; he comes too late;

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCE
line: And so tell your master.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: O Lord, I must laugh!

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Have at you with a proverb--Shall I set in my staff?

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCE
line: Within  Have at you with another; that's--When?

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCE
line: can you tell?

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Within  If thy name be call'd Luce--Luce, thou hast

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: answered him well.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Do you hear, you minion? you'll let us in, I hope?

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCE
line: Within  I thought to have asked you.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Within  And you said no.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: So, come, help: well struck! there was blow for blow.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Thou baggage, let me in.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCE
line: Within  Can you tell for whose sake?

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Master, knock the door hard.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCE
line: Within  Let him knock till it ache.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: You'll cry for this, minion, if I beat the door down.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCE
line: Within  What needs all that, and a pair of stocks in the town?

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Within  Who is that at the door that keeps all

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: this noise?

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Within  By my troth, your town is troubled with

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: unruly boys.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Are you there, wife? you might have come before.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Within  Your wife, sir knave! go get you from the door.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: If you went in pain, master, this 'knave' would go sore.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Here is neither cheer, sir, nor welcome: we would

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANGELO
line: fain have either.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: In debating which was best, we shall part with neither.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: They stand at the door, master; bid them welcome hither.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: There is something in the wind, that we cannot get in.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: You would say so, master, if your garments were thin.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Your cake there is warm within; you stand here in the cold:

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: It would make a man mad as a buck, to be so bought and sold.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Go fetch me something: I'll break ope the gate.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Within  Break any breaking here, and I'll break your

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: knave's pate.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: A man may break a word with you, sir, and words are but wind,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Ay, and break it in your face, so he break it not behind.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Within  It seems thou want'st breaking: out upon

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: thee, hind!
