scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Here's too much 'out upon thee!' I pray thee,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: let me in.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Within  Ay, when fowls have no feathers and fish have no fin.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Well, I'll break in: go borrow me a crow.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: A crow without feather? Master, mean you so?

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: For a fish without a fin, there's a fowl without a feather;

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: If a crow help us in, sirrah, we'll pluck a crow together.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Go get thee gone; fetch me an iron crow.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: Have patience, sir; O, let it not be so!

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: Herein you war against your reputation

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: And draw within the compass of suspect

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: The unviolated honour of your wife.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: Once this,--your long experience of her wisdom,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: Her sober virtue, years and modesty,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: Plead on her part some cause to you unknown:

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: And doubt not, sir, but she will well excuse

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: Why at this time the doors are made against you.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: Be ruled by me: depart in patience,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: And let us to the Tiger all to dinner,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: And about evening come yourself alone

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: To know the reason of this strange restraint.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: If by strong hand you offer to break in

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: Now in the stirring passage of the day,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: A vulgar comment will be made of it,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: And that supposed by the common rout

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: Against your yet ungalled estimation

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: That may with foul intrusion enter in

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: And dwell upon your grave when you are dead;

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: For slander lives upon succession,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: BALTHAZAR
line: For ever housed where it gets possession.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: You have prevailed: I will depart in quiet,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And, in despite of mirth, mean to be merry.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I know a wench of excellent discourse,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Pretty and witty; wild, and yet, too, gentle:

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: There will we dine. This woman that I mean,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: My wife--but, I protest, without desert--

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Hath oftentimes upbraided me withal:

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: To her will we to dinner.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Get you home

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And fetch the chain; by this I know 'tis made:

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Bring it, I pray you, to the Porpentine;

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: For there's the house: that chain will I bestow--

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Be it for nothing but to spite my wife--

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Upon mine hostess there: good sir, make haste.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Since mine own doors refuse to entertain me,

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I'll knock elsewhere, to see if they'll disdain me.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I'll meet you at that place some hour hence.

scene: SCENE I.  Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Do so. This jest shall cost me some expense.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: And may it be that you have quite forgot

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: A husband's office? shall, Antipholus.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Even in the spring of love, thy love-springs rot?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Shall love, in building, grow so ruinous?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: If you did wed my sister for her wealth,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Then for her wealth's sake use her with more kindness:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Or if you like elsewhere, do it by stealth;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Muffle your false love with some show of blindness:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Let not my sister read it in your eye;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Be not thy tongue thy own shame's orator;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Look sweet, be fair, become disloyalty;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Apparel vice like virtue's harbinger;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Bear a fair presence, though your heart be tainted;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Teach sin the carriage of a holy saint;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Be secret-false: what need she be acquainted?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: What simple thief brags of his own attaint?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: 'Tis double wrong, to truant with your bed

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: And let her read it in thy looks at board:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Shame hath a bastard fame, well managed;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Ill deeds are doubled with an evil word.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Alas, poor women! make us but believe,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Being compact of credit, that you love us;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Though others have the arm, show us the sleeve;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: We in your motion turn and you may move us.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Then, gentle brother, get you in again;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Comfort my sister, cheer her, call her wife:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: 'Tis holy sport to be a little vain,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: When the sweet breath of flattery conquers strife.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Sweet mistress--what your name is else, I know not,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Nor by what wonder you do hit of mine,--

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Less in your knowledge and your grace you show not

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Than our earth's wonder, more than earth divine.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Teach me, dear creature, how to think and speak;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Lay open to my earthy-gross conceit,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Smother'd in errors, feeble, shallow, weak,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: The folded meaning of your words' deceit.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Against my soul's pure truth why labour you

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: To make it wander in an unknown field?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Are you a god? would you create me new?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Transform me then, and to your power I'll yield.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: But if that I am I, then well I know

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Your weeping sister is no wife of mine,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Nor to her bed no homage do I owe

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Far more, far more to you do I decline.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: O, train me not, sweet mermaid, with thy note,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: To drown me in thy sister's flood of tears:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Sing, siren, for thyself and I will dote:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Spread o'er the silver waves thy golden hairs,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And as a bed I'll take them and there lie,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And in that glorious supposition think

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: He gains by death that hath such means to die:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Let Love, being light, be drowned if she sink!

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: What, are you mad, that you do reason so?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Not mad, but mated; how, I do not know.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: It is a fault that springeth from your eye.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: For gazing on your beams, fair sun, being by.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Gaze where you should, and that will clear your sight.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: As good to wink, sweet love, as look on night.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Why call you me love? call my sister so.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Thy sister's sister.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: That's my sister.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: No;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: It is thyself, mine own self's better part,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Mine eye's clear eye, my dear heart's dearer heart,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: My food, my fortune and my sweet hope's aim,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: My sole earth's heaven and my heaven's claim.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: All this my sister is, or else should be.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Call thyself sister, sweet, for I am thee.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Thee will I love and with thee lead my life:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Thou hast no husband yet nor I no wife.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Give me thy hand.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: O, soft, air! hold you still:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: I'll fetch my sister, to get her good will.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Why, how now, Dromio! where runn'st thou so fast?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Do you know me, sir? am I Dromio? am I your man?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: am I myself?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Thou art Dromio, thou art my man, thou art thyself.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: I am an ass, I am a woman's man and besides myself.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Marry, sir, besides myself, I am due to a woman; one

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: that claims me, one that haunts me, one that will have me.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What claim lays she to thee?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Marry sir, such claim as you would lay to your

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: horse; and she would have me as a beast: not that, I

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: being a beast, she would have me; but that she,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: being a very beastly creature, lays claim to me.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What is she?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: A very reverent body; ay, such a one as a man may

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: not speak of without he say 'Sir-reverence.' I have

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: but lean luck in the match, and yet is she a

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: wondrous fat marriage.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: How dost thou mean a fat marriage?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Marry, sir, she's the kitchen wench and all grease;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: and I know not what use to put her to but to make a

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: lamp of her and run from her by her own light. I

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: warrant, her rags and the tallow in them will burn a

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Poland winter: if she lives till doomsday,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: she'll burn a week longer than the whole world.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What complexion is she of?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Swart, like my shoe, but her face nothing half so

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: clean kept: for why, she sweats; a man may go over

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: shoes in the grime of it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: That's a fault that water will mend.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: No, sir, 'tis in grain; Noah's flood could not do it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What's her name?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Nell, sir; but her name and three quarters, that's

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: an ell and three quarters, will not measure her from

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: hip to hip.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Then she bears some breadth?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: No longer from head to foot than from hip to hip:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: she is spherical, like a globe; I could find out

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: countries in her.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: In what part of her body stands Ireland?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Marry, in her buttocks: I found it out by the bogs.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Where Scotland?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: I found it by the barrenness; hard in the palm of the hand.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Where France?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: In her forehead; armed and reverted, making war

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: against her heir.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Where England?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: I looked for the chalky cliffs, but I could find no

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: whiteness in them; but I guess it stood in her chin,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: by the salt rheum that ran between France and it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Where Spain?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Faith, I saw it not; but I felt it hot in her breath.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Where America, the Indies?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Oh, sir, upon her nose all o'er embellished with

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: rubies, carbuncles, sapphires, declining their rich

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: aspect to the hot breath of Spain; who sent whole

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: armadoes of caracks to be ballast at her nose.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Where stood Belgia, the Netherlands?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Oh, sir, I did not look so low. To conclude, this

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: drudge, or diviner, laid claim to me, call'd me

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Dromio; swore I was assured to her; told me what

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: privy marks I had about me, as, the mark of my

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: shoulder, the mole in my neck, the great wart on my

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: left arm, that I amazed ran from her as a witch:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: And, I think, if my breast had not been made of

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: faith and my heart of steel,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: She had transform'd me to a curtal dog and made

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: me turn i' the wheel.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Go hie thee presently, post to the road:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: An if the wind blow any way from shore,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I will not harbour in this town to-night:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: If any bark put forth, come to the mart,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Where I will walk till thou return to me.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: If every one knows us and we know none,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: 'Tis time, I think, to trudge, pack and be gone.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: As from a bear a man would run for life,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: So fly I from her that would be my wife.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: There's none but witches do inhabit here;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And therefore 'tis high time that I were hence.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: She that doth call me husband, even my soul

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Doth for a wife abhor. But her fair sister,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Possess'd with such a gentle sovereign grace,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Of such enchanting presence and discourse,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Hath almost made me traitor to myself:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: But, lest myself be guilty to self-wrong,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I'll stop mine ears against the mermaid's song.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Master Antipholus,--

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Ay, that's my name.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I know it well, sir, lo, here is the chain.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I thought to have ta'en you at the Porpentine:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANGELO
line: The chain unfinish'd made me stay thus long.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What is your will that I shall do with this?

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANGELO
line: What please yourself, sir: I have made it for you.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Made it for me, sir! I bespoke it not.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Not once, nor twice, but twenty times you have.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Go home with it and please your wife withal;

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANGELO
line: And soon at supper-time I'll visit you

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANGELO
line: And then receive my money for the chain.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I pray you, sir, receive the money now,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: For fear you ne'er see chain nor money more.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANGELO
line: You are a merry man, sir: fare you well.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What I should think of this, I cannot tell:

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: But this I think, there's no man is so vain

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: That would refuse so fair an offer'd chain.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I see a man here needs not live by shifts,

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: When in the streets he meets such golden gifts.

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I'll to the mart, and there for Dromio stay

scene: SCENE II.  The same.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: If any ship put out, then straight away.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: You know since Pentecost the sum is due,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: And since I have not much importuned you;

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: Nor now I had not, but that I am bound

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: To Persia, and want guilders for my voyage:

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: Therefore make present satisfaction,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: Or I'll attach you by this officer.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Even just the sum that I do owe to you

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Is growing to me by Antipholus,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: And in the instant that I met with you

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: He had of me a chain: at five o'clock

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I shall receive the money for the same.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Pleaseth you walk with me down to his house,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I will discharge my bond and thank you too.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Officer
line: That labour may you save: see where he comes.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: While I go to the goldsmith's house, go thou

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And buy a rope's end: that will I bestow

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Among my wife and her confederates,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: For locking me out of my doors by day.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: But, soft! I see the goldsmith. Get thee gone;

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Buy thou a rope and bring it home to me.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: I buy a thousand pound a year: I buy a rope.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: A man is well holp up that trusts to you:

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I promised your presence and the chain;

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: But neither chain nor goldsmith came to me.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Belike you thought our love would last too long,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: If it were chain'd together, and therefore came not.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Saving your merry humour, here's the note

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: How much your chain weighs to the utmost carat,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: The fineness of the gold and chargeful fashion.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Which doth amount to three odd ducats more

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Than I stand debted to this gentleman:

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I pray you, see him presently discharged,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: For he is bound to sea and stays but for it.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I am not furnish'd with the present money;

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Besides, I have some business in the town.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Good signior, take the stranger to my house

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And with you take the chain and bid my wife

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Disburse the sum on the receipt thereof:

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Perchance I will be there as soon as you.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Then you will bring the chain to her yourself?

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: No; bear it with you, lest I come not time enough.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Well, sir, I will. Have you the chain about you?

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: An if I have not, sir, I hope you have;

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Or else you may return without your money.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Nay, come, I pray you, sir, give me the chain:

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Both wind and tide stays for this gentleman,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: And I, to blame, have held him here too long.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Good Lord! you use this dalliance to excuse

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Your breach of promise to the Porpentine.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I should have chid you for not bringing it,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: But, like a shrew, you first begin to brawl.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: The hour steals on; I pray you, sir, dispatch.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: You hear how he importunes me;--the chain!

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Why, give it to my wife and fetch your money.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Come, come, you know I gave it you even now.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Either send the chain or send me by some token.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Fie, now you run this humour out of breath,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: where's the chain? I pray you, let me see it.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: My business cannot brook this dalliance.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: Good sir, say whether you'll answer me or no:

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: If not, I'll leave him to the officer.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I answer you! what should I answer you?

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: The money that you owe me for the chain.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I owe you none till I receive the chain.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: You know I gave it you half an hour since.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: You gave me none: you wrong me much to say so.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: You wrong me more, sir, in denying it:

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Consider how it stands upon my credit.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: Well, officer, arrest him at my suit.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Officer
line: I do; and charge you in the duke's name to obey me.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: This touches me in reputation.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Either consent to pay this sum for me

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Or I attach you by this officer.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Consent to pay thee that I never had!

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Arrest me, foolish fellow, if thou darest.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Here is thy fee; arrest him, officer,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I would not spare my brother in this case,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: If he should scorn me so apparently.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: Officer
line: I do arrest you, sir: you hear the suit.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I do obey thee till I give thee bail.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: But, sirrah, you shall buy this sport as dear

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: As all the metal in your shop will answer.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Sir, sir, I will have law in Ephesus,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANGELO
line: To your notorious shame; I doubt it not.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Master, there is a bark of Epidamnum

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: That stays but till her owner comes aboard,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: And then, sir, she bears away. Our fraughtage, sir,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: I have convey'd aboard; and I have bought

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: The oil, the balsamum and aqua-vitae.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: The ship is in her trim; the merry wind

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Blows fair from land: they stay for nought at all

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: But for their owner, master, and yourself.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: How now! a madman! Why, thou peevish sheep,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: What ship of Epidamnum stays for me?

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: A ship you sent me to, to hire waftage.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Thou drunken slave, I sent thee for a rope;

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And told thee to what purpose and what end.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: You sent me for a rope's end as soon:

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: You sent me to the bay, sir, for a bark.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I will debate this matter at more leisure

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And teach your ears to list me with more heed.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: To Adriana, villain, hie thee straight:

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Give her this key, and tell her, in the desk

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: That's cover'd o'er with Turkish tapestry,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: There is a purse of ducats; let her send it:

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Tell her I am arrested in the street

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And that shall bail me; hie thee, slave, be gone!

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: On, officer, to prison till it come.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: To Adriana! that is where we dined,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Where Dowsabel did claim me for her husband:

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: She is too big, I hope, for me to compass.

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Thither I must, although against my will,

scene: SCENE I.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: For servants must their masters' minds fulfil.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Ah, Luciana, did he tempt thee so?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Mightst thou perceive austerely in his eye

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: That he did plead in earnest? yea or no?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Look'd he or red or pale, or sad or merrily?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: What observation madest thou in this case

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Of his heart's meteors tilting in his face?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: First he denied you had in him no right.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: He meant he did me none; the more my spite.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Then swore he that he was a stranger here.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And true he swore, though yet forsworn he were.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Then pleaded I for you.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And what said he?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: That love I begg'd for you he begg'd of me.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: With what persuasion did he tempt thy love?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: With words that in an honest suit might move.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: First he did praise my beauty, then my speech.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Didst speak him fair?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Have patience, I beseech.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I cannot, nor I will not, hold me still;

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: My tongue, though not my heart, shall have his will.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: He is deformed, crooked, old and sere,

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Ill-faced, worse bodied, shapeless everywhere;

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Vicious, ungentle, foolish, blunt, unkind;

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Stigmatical in making, worse in mind.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Who would be jealous then of such a one?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: No evil lost is wail'd when it is gone.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Ah, but I think him better than I say,

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And yet would herein others' eyes were worse.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Far from her nest the lapwing cries away:

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: My heart prays for him, though my tongue do curse.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Here! go; the desk, the purse! sweet, now, make haste.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: How hast thou lost thy breath?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: By running fast.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Where is thy master, Dromio? is he well?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: No, he's in Tartar limbo, worse than hell.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: A devil in an everlasting garment hath him;

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: One whose hard heart is button'd up with steel;

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: A fiend, a fury, pitiless and rough;

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: A wolf, nay, worse, a fellow all in buff;

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: A back-friend, a shoulder-clapper, one that

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: countermands

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: The passages of alleys, creeks and narrow lands;

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: A hound that runs counter and yet draws dryfoot well;

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: One that before the judgement carries poor souls to hell.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Why, man, what is the matter?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: I do not know the matter: he is 'rested on the case.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: What, is he arrested? Tell me at whose suit.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: I know not at whose suit he is arrested well;

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: But he's in a suit of buff which 'rested him, that can I tell.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Will you send him, mistress, redemption, the money in his desk?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Go fetch it, sister.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: This I wonder at,

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: That he, unknown to me, should be in debt.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Tell me, was he arrested on a band?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Not on a band, but on a stronger thing;

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: A chain, a chain! Do you not hear it ring?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: What, the chain?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: No, no, the bell: 'tis time that I were gone:

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: It was two ere I left him, and now the clock

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: strikes one.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: The hours come back! that did I never hear.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: O, yes; if any hour meet a sergeant, a' turns back for

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: very fear.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: As if Time were in debt! how fondly dost thou reason!

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Time is a very bankrupt, and owes more than he's

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: worth, to season.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Nay, he's a thief too: have you not heard men say

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: That Time comes stealing on by night and day?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: If Time be in debt and theft, and a sergeant in the way,

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Hath he not reason to turn back an hour in a day?

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Go, Dromio; there's the money, bear it straight;

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And bring thy master home immediately.

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Come, sister: I am press'd down with conceit--

scene: SCENE II.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Conceit, my comfort and my injury.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: There's not a man I meet but doth salute me

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: As if I were their well-acquainted friend;

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And every one doth call me by my name.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Some tender money to me; some invite me;

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Some other give me thanks for kindnesses;

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Some offer me commodities to buy:

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Even now a tailor call'd me in his shop

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And show'd me silks that he had bought for me,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And therewithal took measure of my body.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Sure, these are but imaginary wiles

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And Lapland sorcerers inhabit here.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Master, here's the gold you sent me for. What, have

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: you got the picture of old Adam new-apparelled?

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What gold is this? what Adam dost thou mean?

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Not that Adam that kept the Paradise but that Adam

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: that keeps the prison: he that goes in the calf's

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: skin that was killed for the Prodigal; he that came

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: behind you, sir, like an evil angel, and bid you

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: forsake your liberty.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I understand thee not.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: No? why, 'tis a plain case: he that went, like a

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: bass-viol, in a case of leather; the man, sir,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: that, when gentlemen are tired, gives them a sob

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: and 'rests them; he, sir, that takes pity on decayed

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: men and gives them suits of durance; he that sets up

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: his rest to do more exploits with his mace than a

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: morris-pike.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: What, thou meanest an officer?

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Ay, sir, the sergeant of the band, he that brings

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: any man to answer it that breaks his band; one that

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: thinks a man always going to bed, and says, 'God

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: give you good rest!'

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Well, sir, there rest in your foolery. Is there any

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Why, sir, I brought you word an hour since that the

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: bark Expedition put forth to-night; and then were

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: you hindered by the sergeant, to tarry for the hoy

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Delay. Here are the angels that you sent for to

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: deliver you.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: The fellow is distract, and so am I;

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: And here we wander in illusions:

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Some blessed power deliver us from hence!

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Well met, well met, Master Antipholus.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: I see, sir, you have found the goldsmith now:

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Is that the chain you promised me to-day?

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Satan, avoid! I charge thee, tempt me not.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Master, is this Mistress Satan?

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: It is the devil.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Nay, she is worse, she is the devil's dam; and here

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: she comes in the habit of a light wench: and thereof

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: comes that the wenches say 'God damn me;' that's as

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: much to say 'God make me a light wench.' It is

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: written, they appear to men like angels of light:

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: light is an effect of fire, and fire will burn;

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: ergo, light wenches will burn. Come not near her.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Your man and you are marvellous merry, sir.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Will you go with me? We'll mend our dinner here?

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Master, if you do, expect spoon-meat; or bespeak a

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: long spoon.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Why, Dromio?

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Marry, he must have a long spoon that must eat with

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: the devil.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Avoid then, fiend! what tell'st thou me of supping?

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Thou art, as you are all, a sorceress:

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I conjure thee to leave me and be gone.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Give me the ring of mine you had at dinner,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Or, for my diamond, the chain you promised,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: And I'll be gone, sir, and not trouble you.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Some devils ask but the parings of one's nail,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: A rush, a hair, a drop of blood, a pin,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: A nut, a cherry-stone;

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: But she, more covetous, would have a chain.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Master, be wise: an if you give it her,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: The devil will shake her chain and fright us with it.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: I pray you, sir, my ring, or else the chain:

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: I hope you do not mean to cheat me so.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Avaunt, thou witch! Come, Dromio, let us go.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: 'Fly pride,' says the peacock: mistress, that you know.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Now, out of doubt Antipholus is mad,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Else would he never so demean himself.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: A ring he hath of mine worth forty ducats,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: And for the same he promised me a chain:

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Both one and other he denies me now.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: The reason that I gather he is mad,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Besides this present instance of his rage,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Is a mad tale he told to-day at dinner,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Of his own doors being shut against his entrance.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Belike his wife, acquainted with his fits,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: On purpose shut the doors against his way.

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: My way is now to hie home to his house,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: And tell his wife that, being lunatic,

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: He rush'd into my house and took perforce

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: My ring away. This course I fittest choose;

scene: SCENE III.  A public place.
speaker: Courtezan
line: For forty ducats is too much to lose.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Fear me not, man; I will not break away:

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I'll give thee, ere I leave thee, so much money,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: To warrant thee, as I am 'rested for.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: My wife is in a wayward mood to-day,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And will not lightly trust the messenger

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: That I should be attach'd in Ephesus,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I tell you, 'twill sound harshly in her ears.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Here comes my man; I think he brings the money.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: How now, sir! have you that I sent you for?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Here's that, I warrant you, will pay them all.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: But where's the money?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Why, sir, I gave the money for the rope.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Five hundred ducats, villain, for a rope?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: I'll serve you, sir, five hundred at the rate.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: To what end did I bid thee hie thee home?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: To a rope's-end, sir; and to that end am I returned.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And to that end, sir, I will welcome you.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Officer
line: Good sir, be patient.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Nay, 'tis for me to be patient; I am in adversity.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Officer
line: Good, now, hold thy tongue.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Nay, rather persuade him to hold his hands.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Thou whoreson, senseless villain!

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: I would I were senseless, sir, that I might not feel

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: your blows.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: I am an ass, indeed; you may prove it by my long

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: ears. I have served him from the hour of my

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: nativity to this instant, and have nothing at his

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: hands for my service but blows. When I am cold, he

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: heats me with beating; when I am warm, he cools me

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: with beating; I am waked with it when I sleep;

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: raised with it when I sit; driven out of doors with

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: it when I go from home; welcomed home with it when

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: I return; nay, I bear it on my shoulders, as a

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: beggar wont her brat; and, I think when he hath

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: lamed me, I shall beg with it from door to door.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Come, go along; my wife is coming yonder.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Mistress, 'respice finem,' respect your end; or

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: rather, the prophecy like the parrot, 'beware the

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: rope's-end.'

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Wilt thou still talk?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Courtezan
line: How say you now? is not your husband mad?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: His incivility confirms no less.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Good Doctor Pinch, you are a conjurer;

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Establish him in his true sense again,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And I will please you what you will demand.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Alas, how fiery and how sharp he looks!

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Mark how he trembles in his ecstasy!

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: PINCH
line: Give me your hand and let me feel your pulse.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: There is my hand, and let it feel your ear.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: PINCH
line: I charge thee, Satan, housed within this man,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: PINCH
line: To yield possession to my holy prayers

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: PINCH
line: And to thy state of darkness hie thee straight:

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: PINCH
line: I conjure thee by all the saints in heaven!

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Peace, doting wizard, peace! I am not mad.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: O, that thou wert not, poor distressed soul!

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: You minion, you, are these your customers?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Did this companion with the saffron face

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Revel and feast it at my house to-day,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Whilst upon me the guilty doors were shut

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And I denied to enter in my house?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: O husband, God doth know you dined at home;

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Where would you had remain'd until this time,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Free from these slanders and this open shame!

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Dined at home! Thou villain, what sayest thou?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Sir, sooth to say, you did not dine at home.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Were not my doors lock'd up and I shut out?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Perdie, your doors were lock'd and you shut out.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And did not she herself revile me there?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Sans fable, she herself reviled you there.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Did not her kitchen-maid rail, taunt, and scorn me?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Certes, she did; the kitchen-vestal scorn'd you.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And did not I in rage depart from thence?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: In verity you did; my bones bear witness,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: That since have felt the vigour of his rage.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Is't good to soothe him in these contraries?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: PINCH
line: It is no shame: the fellow finds his vein,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: PINCH
line: And yielding to him humours well his frenzy.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Thou hast suborn'd the goldsmith to arrest me.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Alas, I sent you money to redeem you,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: By Dromio here, who came in haste for it.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Money by me! heart and goodwill you might;

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: But surely master, not a rag of money.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Went'st not thou to her for a purse of ducats?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: He came to me and I deliver'd it.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: And I am witness with her that she did.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: God and the rope-maker bear me witness

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: That I was sent for nothing but a rope!

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: PINCH
line: Mistress, both man and master is possess'd;

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: PINCH
line: I know it by their pale and deadly looks:

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: PINCH
line: They must be bound and laid in some dark room.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Say, wherefore didst thou lock me forth to-day?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And why dost thou deny the bag of gold?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I did not, gentle husband, lock thee forth.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: And, gentle master, I received no gold;

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: But I confess, sir, that we were lock'd out.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Dissembling villain, thou speak'st false in both.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Dissembling harlot, thou art false in all;

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: And art confederate with a damned pack

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: To make a loathsome abject scorn of me:

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: But with these nails I'll pluck out these false eyes

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: That would behold in me this shameful sport.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: O, bind him, bind him! let him not come near me.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: PINCH
line: More company! The fiend is strong within him.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: Ay me, poor man, how pale and wan he looks!

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: What, will you murder me? Thou gaoler, thou,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: I am thy prisoner: wilt thou suffer them

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: To make a rescue?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Officer
line: Masters, let him go

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Officer
line: He is my prisoner, and you shall not have him.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: PINCH
line: Go bind this man, for he is frantic too.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: What wilt thou do, thou peevish officer?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Hast thou delight to see a wretched man

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Do outrage and displeasure to himself?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Officer
line: He is my prisoner: if I let him go,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Officer
line: The debt he owes will be required of me.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I will discharge thee ere I go from thee:

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Bear me forthwith unto his creditor,

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And, knowing how the debt grows, I will pay it.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Good master doctor, see him safe convey'd

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Home to my house. O most unhappy day!

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: O most unhappy strumpet!

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Master, I am here entered in bond for you.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
line: Out on thee, villain! wherefore dost thou mad me?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: Will you be bound for nothing? be mad, good master:

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
line: cry 'The devil!'

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: God help, poor souls, how idly do they talk!

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Go bear him hence. Sister, go you with me.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Say now, whose suit is he arrested at?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Officer
line: One Angelo, a goldsmith: do you know him?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I know the man. What is the sum he owes?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Officer
line: Two hundred ducats.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Say, how grows it due?

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Officer
line: Due for a chain your husband had of him.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: He did bespeak a chain for me, but had it not.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Courtezan
line: When as your husband all in rage to-day

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Came to my house and took away my ring--

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Courtezan
line: The ring I saw upon his finger now--

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Courtezan
line: Straight after did I meet him with a chain.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: It may be so, but I did never see it.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Come, gaoler, bring me where the goldsmith is:

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: I long to know the truth hereof at large.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: LUCIANA
line: God, for thy mercy! they are loose again.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And come with naked swords.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Let's call more help to have them bound again.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: Officer
line: Away! they'll kill us.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I see these witches are afraid of swords.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: She that would be your wife now ran from you.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Come to the Centaur; fetch our stuff from thence:

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I long that we were safe and sound aboard.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Faith, stay here this night; they will surely do us

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: no harm: you saw they speak us fair, give us gold:

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: methinks they are such a gentle nation that, but for

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: the mountain of mad flesh that claims marriage of

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: me, I could find in my heart to stay here still and

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: turn witch.

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I will not stay to-night for all the town;

scene: SCENE IV.  A street.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Therefore away, to get our stuff aboard.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I am sorry, sir, that I have hinder'd you;

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: But, I protest, he had the chain of me,

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Though most dishonestly he doth deny it.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: How is the man esteemed here in the city?

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Of very reverend reputation, sir,

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Of credit infinite, highly beloved,

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Second to none that lives here in the city:

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: His word might bear my wealth at any time.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: Speak softly; yonder, as I think, he walks.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: 'Tis so; and that self chain about his neck

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Which he forswore most monstrously to have.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Good sir, draw near to me, I'll speak to him.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Signior Antipholus, I wonder much

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: That you would put me to this shame and trouble;

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: And, not without some scandal to yourself,

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: With circumstance and oaths so to deny

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: This chain which now you wear so openly:

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Beside the charge, the shame, imprisonment,

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: You have done wrong to this my honest friend,

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Who, but for staying on our controversy,

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: Had hoisted sail and put to sea to-day:

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: This chain you had of me; can you deny it?

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I think I had; I never did deny it.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: Yes, that you did, sir, and forswore it too.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Who heard me to deny it or forswear it?

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: These ears of mine, thou know'st did hear thee.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: Fie on thee, wretch! 'tis pity that thou livest

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: To walk where any honest man resort.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Thou art a villain to impeach me thus:

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: I'll prove mine honour and mine honesty

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
line: Against thee presently, if thou darest stand.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: I dare, and do defy thee for a villain.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Hold, hurt him not, for God's sake! he is mad.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Some get within him, take his sword away:

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Bind Dromio too, and bear them to my house.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: Run, master, run; for God's sake, take a house!

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
line: This is some priory. In, or we are spoil'd!

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: AEMELIA
line: Be quiet, people. Wherefore throng you hither?

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: To fetch my poor distracted husband hence.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Let us come in, that we may bind him fast

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And bear him home for his recovery.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ANGELO
line: I knew he was not in his perfect wits.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: Second Merchant
line: I am sorry now that I did draw on him.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: AEMELIA
line: How long hath this possession held the man?

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: This week he hath been heavy, sour, sad,

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And much different from the man he was;

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: But till this afternoon his passion

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Ne'er brake into extremity of rage.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: AEMELIA
line: Hath he not lost much wealth by wreck of sea?

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: AEMELIA
line: Buried some dear friend? Hath not else his eye

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: AEMELIA
line: Stray'd his affection in unlawful love?

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: AEMELIA
line: A sin prevailing much in youthful men,

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: AEMELIA
line: Who give their eyes the liberty of gazing.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: AEMELIA
line: Which of these sorrows is he subject to?

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: To none of these, except it be the last;

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Namely, some love that drew him oft from home.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: AEMELIA
line: You should for that have reprehended him.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Why, so I did.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: AEMELIA
line: Ay, but not rough enough.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: As roughly as my modesty would let me.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: AEMELIA
line: Haply, in private.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: And in assemblies too.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: AEMELIA
line: Ay, but not enough.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: It was the copy of our conference:

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: In bed he slept not for my urging it;

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: At board he fed not for my urging it;

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Alone, it was the subject of my theme;

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: In company I often glanced it;

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
speaker: ADRIANA
line: Still did I tell him it was vile and bad.

scene: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
